hBvuLb_dyInYxLNCKlxgDw.text: Wonderful new place we tried out today. Loved the lamb burger! Great portion size and very filling. The pakoras go wonderfully with the sauces and the spring roll was done beautifully. Will be coming back soon.

1YQMo3rkPkjSDGVItnTBvQ.text: Great Indian food with a kick. Had two different pakora dishes, chicken and fish, both were excellent.

m0Ye99H9__K_qOfLQ3ESlw.text: Lovely meal from The Pakora Bar! Also enjoyed the small talk with the friendly staff. I'll be recommending this place to others!

N8etlQsh_oGNAEAp7b0_kA.text: I enjoyed a fresh and delicious mixed pakora plate and mango lassi. Really well priced and generous portions. The gentleman who served me was very friendly and accommodating. Will definitely be back!

gb4iuMxHcQ0MOvpIHqJhZw.text: Found this place walking through Edinburgh and was very happy with my experience. The small cafe with community seating offers a great setting for this tasty food. We got the pakora's: paneer and veggie haggis, both were very good and spiced well. We also got the spring rolls which were cooked to perfection. Overall I was happy with my experience here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

NFDtOYW0ZD5MPQgGwl7Jcg.text: A fun oasis amongst tons of surrounding restaurants. The chicken and veggie spring rolls are not to be missed as are the selection of sauces. The Lentil Dahl is healthy and memorable and a reason to come back. A perfect place to head to when you have limited time but a huge appetite in Edinburg. Fresh yet served quickly. The staff is cheerful and well informed. A must to visit.

fuaQ7n3TbhST9ITCitFQJQ.text: Looking for a small evening snack after enjoying cocktails next door, the Pakora Bar had caught my eye since we arrived in Edinburgh and I'd been wanting to try it. Service was excellent! Everyone was friendly and helpful. I couldn't decide between the fish or paneer pakora. Our server suggested we do half and half. I love being able to have that option especially being generally indecisive and always wanting variety! It was the perfect option and the perfect amount of food for us. Each pakora dish also comes with a sauce. Again, our server suggested we try two different ones and he would give us half of a spicy sauce and half yogurt based and we were only charged for one sauce. Both pakoras were fantastic. Especially the fish, it was so flavourful. I highly recommend this place and wish that I could have more time in Edinburgh so I can come back and try more dishes here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

q2RwchIMGFdUprapDxoIAA.text: So glad I trusted the yelp reviews and took the time to come here! Also glad I had skipped breakfast because the food was phenomenal. I especially enjoyed the cauliflower pakoras, but the vegetable curry was also delicious. Very well seasoned and pleasantly spicy for my rather potato-level taste buds. Very friendly and attentive staff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. cauliflower pakora

J_-8TrH4hoaWcWAxv1U3iA.text: Loved this place so much-- Haggis pakora 4 lyfe! Service is aces.

1JMV3ygMygYjkyBi8ZaWTw.text: What a wonderful new place! The owner is a True entrepreneur and the food is absolutely amazing. I wish this place the very best, and highly recommend!!!!!!! (Get the mango lassi)

photos.caption: Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

bFGvJCuCr_qoBX6UeMlz2A.text: Outstanding food and service!!! Initially when we entered we were asked if we ordered something for takeaway and since we only found 3-4 tables and no one sitting around we were quite confused whether to to stay and order or not. But luckily we decided to give it a try. My favorite is the marinated and fried cauliflower. DEFINITELY a try worth when close to in Edinburgh!!! Enjoy :-)

V1wEM0ucC-C-FpXbauY_hA.text: Amazing food for an amazing value, and the service was among the best I've ever had, if not the best. Thanks for the personal service and delicious meal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

FHwWleMqddpT2sBoZ7AEKA.text: Outstanding! I ordered cauliflower pakoras and mixed vegetable samosas to share, plus lentil, carrot and coriander dhal for myself. My husband, who is not really fond of Indian food, raved about his spicy chicken and dhal with rice. He also indulged in some Lind and Lime gin, which is distilled locally. Also, as an American, can I please comment on the excellent tap water served. Our water is nowhere near as good.

3af7hWtXIHnpKNv7p4NJtg.text: Delicious food delightful owners. I wish they would open a restaurant inLA! The meal was flavorful and just the right amount.

9lGIdfOF6k2TX53XKac_dw.text: Found this place by chance when walking around the area near Princes Street. The Pakora Bar serves fresh Indian food and specializes in an Indian batter used to fry all sorts of ingredients called pakora. We tried the pakora chicken and fish (5 pieces each plate which was a good amount). We also tried the fresh mango sauce and the punjab sauce (both are great choices). Both dishes were very good. The spices were great and the fish was very fresh. The staff was very helpful in explaining the menu and ingredients. All of this for a very affordable price. Will definitely come back to this new and upcoming restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The great pakora fish

ywLr-iwNjd1fYvdnBOxwzw.text: We were looking for somewhere to go for dinner when we spotted The Pakora Bar. Turns out to have only opened a couple of weeks ago, but this place definitely deserves to be a success. The staff in there were extremely friendly and nice, and explained all their efforts to ensure the food was suitable for vegetarians and people with gluten-intolerance. Despite their best efforts, there was a slight potential issue with cross-contamination, but they happily cooked some fresh pakora and samosas in new oil.   The food was delicious, with some terrific sauces. Don't go expecting a restaurant experience, as it's more of a street food cafe. However, if you like your food fresh, hot and tasty then this is a great location. No alcohol license yet, but they've made an application.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious kebabs (already started eating!)
Photo of The Pakora Bar - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

V2lKiaxXaABNuIGM-hUb_g.text: Keenly priced (based on one visit sitting in) range of pakoras (10 or so types), dhal soups and other such items with friendly service, occasional DJ sets and late opening for the post-club crowd this is a good local addition to the city's quality fast food outlets.  No toilet though so keep that in mind if planning to sit in.

bPWbIq686acM3ykop2qDdg.text: This food was AMAZING!! Not too familiar with Indian food but the waiter was very helpful and steered us in the right direction. We are everything!!  Wish we had time to revisit before having to leave.

38_L_c2vJojMLt2DPeqHnw.text: So delicious and the staff was excellent and very friendly! Great options for vegetarians and meat eaters alike.

t314qYzXXgwNXhG2Fuw3Hg.text: We really enjoyed The Pakora Bar- so much in fact we came back twice during our visit to Edinburgh. Good location in New Town as our hotel was just around the corner- nice place for a quick lunch or takeout.  Food was flavorful, prices were good, and the staff were friendly.  Definitely recommend this place.

3m41Aw5dtNQHVkNPbla0CA.text: Amazing food. Fresh, definitely not frozen. It's a pity that I don't live here, because I feel like I'm addicted after only one visit. I don't know what I'm going to do once I get back to the states... guess I'll have to eat here a bunch of times before I leave! If you like indian food, make sure that you check this place out!

kb-AH9p2zqNVPIQbS254-Q.text: Amazing food, great staff. Intimate, cozy restaurant with some of the best Punjabi food I've had. Very authentic with medium spice (can be made spicier), reasonable portion sizes, and fantastic food. I can't stress enough how delicious this place is. And the staff is super friendly and quite funny. Be sure to make time for a bite at the Pakora Bar

gObZbgxqv3EXaIuRDUbuTA.text: No frills tasty food. Had haggis and chicken pakora mix which was perfect to share for two. I had the spicy sausage and my partner had their chicken curry. The sauces are amazing as are the spicy onions. Perfect portions. It's a takeaway essentially so no bathroom but would recommend going for food then over to the pub for a drink.  Is also perfect after a night out. Nice fresh food and pretty sure it'd be as good the morning after haha! Give it a whirl. Really friendly and welcoming.

y7w6uN2ucc1GD0IRsB0X8g.text: Wow best Indian Wrap I ever tasted, if your near well worth the time to visit
